info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford and southwestern Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Marion, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Morganton, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, South Mountains State Park, Lake James, Nebo, Thermal City, Glenwood and Union Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western North Carolina.
